questions.text: Who does not participate in 'game night' at the Griffin household?
questions.explanation:
Loretta.

	Loretta doesn't participate because she and Cleveland decided to get divorced in the previous episode, "The Loretta-Cleveland Quagmire".  Everyone plays "Twister", a civil rights game, and a more dangerous version of paintball.

Quagmire.

	Instead of playing paintball with actual paintball guns, Joe brings everyone some real guns and ammo from the police station and they spend some time shooting each other in the house.  Quagmire gets shot in the leg and he goes to the hospital before the gang plays the next game.

Peter.

	Lois switches Peter's questions with questions from the preschool version of the game and he wins the game with really easy questions.  Peter decides to apply for a grant because he thinks he's a genius.

questions.text: According to 'National Geographic', what is a dangerous predator?
questions.explanation:
The fire truck.

	Peter once watched an episode of 'National Geographic about the lifestyles of the wild fire truck.  In the end of the episode, Peter is attacked by a fire truck in his front yard.

questions.text: When Peter and Lois visit a fancy restaurant, what does Peter order?
questions.explanation:
Soup.

	After Peter is declared mentally retarded, Peter is getting special treatment from everyone.  At the restaurant, Peter is forced to wear a helmet and water wings.

questions.text: Who does Peter run over in his car in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Tom Tucker.

	Although Peter runs Tom Tucker over, Tom decides not to do anything about it since Peter has a mental condition.  Peter also runs over Tom's hooker, but she was dead to begin with.  William Shatner was also hit by a car, but this occurred in the second episode in the series.

questions.text: What is the name of the social worker assigned to help Peter?
questions.explanation:
Verne.

	Verne tries to keep Peter creative and positive, and Lois is disappointed because she thinks that Peter is taking things too far.

questions.text: Who is forced to go to the hospital after getting burnt?
questions.explanation:
Lois.

	Peter accidentally splashed Lois with a deep-fryer full of burning grease and she was forced to be in a full-body cast.  In the end of the episode, she comes home smelling like french fries.

questions.text: After child services take the children away, who takes care of them?
questions.explanation:
Cleveland.

	Cleveland ends up forcing Chris and Stewie to share a bed, and he lets Meg have a sleep-over with her friends.  During the sleepover, Quagmire hides behind the couch, but he leaves when they decide to talk for a long time.

questions.text: What product was Stewie once in a commercial for?
questions.explanation:
Ipod.

	After this is mentioned, a fake commercial of Ipod appears in which Stewie's silhouette is dancing with an Ipod.  In the end of the episode, everything goes back to normal, and everyone is reunited.
